intro: Millettia sphaerosperma, commonly known as the globe-seeded millettia, is a member of the legume family Fabaceae. It is a small, deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its fruit is a distinctive globe-shaped pod containing several seeds. Millettia sphaerosperma is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
